DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior Chemotherapy Taxane Compound LTE Grade 1 Neuropathy No Disease Progression Prior Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating a patient meets the eligibility criteria for participation in a clinical trial regarding prior taxane therapy administration when neuropathy is less than or equal to grade 1 and there has been no history of disease progression while on taxane therapy prior to study enrollment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior Chemotherapy Taxane Compound LTE Grade 1 Neuropathy No Disease Progression Prior Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Previous chemotherapy administered as treatment for this cancer._A type of drug that blocks cell growth by stopping mitosis (cell division). Taxanes interfere with microtubules (cellular structures that help move chromosomes during mitosis). They are used to treat cancer. A taxane is a type of mitotic inhibitor and a type of antimicrotubule agent._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways._A morphologic qualifier indicating that a cancerous lesion is well differentiated._A disorder affecting the cranial nerves or the peripheral nervous system. It manifests with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness. It may be the result of physical injury, toxic substances, viral diseases, diabetes, renal failure, cancer, and drugs._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._The worsening of a disease over time._Earlier in time or order._A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Prior Chemotherapy Taxane Compound Less Than or Equal To Grade 1 Neuropathy Negation Disease Progression Prior Clinical Trial Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Previous chemotherapy administered as treatment for this cancer.:A type of drug that blocks cell growth by stopping mitosis (cell division). Taxanes interfere with microtubules (cellular structures that help move chromosomes during mitosis). They are used to treat cancer. A taxane is a type of mitotic inhibitor and a type of antimicrotubule agent.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.:A morphologic qualifier indicating that a cancerous lesion is well differentiated.:A disorder affecting the cranial nerves or the peripheral nervous system. It manifests with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness. It may be the result of physical injury, toxic substances, viral diseases, diabetes, renal failure, cancer, and drugs.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:The worsening of a disease over time.:Earlier in time or order.:A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Previous chemotherapy administered as treatment for this cancer.

A type of drug that blocks cell growth by stopping mitosis (cell division). Taxanes interfere with microtubules (cellular structures that help move chromosomes during mitosis). They are used to treat cancer. A taxane is a type of mitotic inhibitor and a type of antimicrotubule agent.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.
A morphologic qualifier indicating that a cancerous lesion is well differentiated.

A disorder affecting the cranial nerves or the peripheral nervous system. It manifests with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness. It may be the result of physical injury, toxic substances, viral diseases, diabetes, renal failure, cancer, and drugs.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.
Earlier in time or order.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has received prior
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior taxane, patient is not experiencing grade greater than 1 neuropathy and had no history of disease progression on a taxane therapy within 6 months prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior taxane, patient is not experiencing grade greater than 1 neuropathy and had no history of disease progression on a taxane therapy within 3 months prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior taxane, patient is not experiencing grade greater than 1 neuropathy and had no history of disease progression on a taxane therapy within months prior to study enrollment?
